title: Sequence labelling: Annotate across line breaks
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
Based on latest doccano docker image and master-branch (reproducible in both cases)

* Create a project for sequence labelling (NER)
* configure a few SPAN-labels
* upload a textfile to annotate (should have long text that breaks into multiple lines or text with line-breaks
* start annotation
* Given line 1 and line 2,
** Annotate a few spans in the middle of line 1 and line 2
** try to mark with mouse for annotation the last word on line 1 - together with - first word of line 2
** The marker will highlight the last word of line 1 and first word of line 2 but also other existing labels

expected:
* the span label menu shows up for me to chose the label-type

actual:
* nothing happens

Screenshot:
I tried to label the two-word span "especially the"
* it highlights in purple the other text spans too
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5815009/173187133-2afbfd01-a157-425d-93bc-8cfb8cc52c60.png)


Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Linux
*   Python Version Used: 3.8
*   When you install doccano: 10th of June 2022
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): via docker, pip install and plain master-branch (reproducible for all 3)

Special comment:
===============
I'm interested to contribute this improvement to the project myself, but I can't find the code to the v-annotator component.

I have noticed for larger labeling projects, the text becomes hard to read because all the markings.
I'm interested as well to help adjust the visual markings so that the text remains well readable.

Let me know how I can help.
Of course all contributes back to the open source community
